name: 林正釧
objective: Granular material flows commonly occur in many industrial applications and nature hazards, such as fluidized beds, additive manufacturing, and debris avalanche. To provide a comprehensive understanding of granular materials flows, this course will be divided into three parts. First, we will explore the fundamental flow characteristics of granular materials and their rheological models. Next, we will examine simulation techniques for granular material flows, focusing on discrete element method (DEM). Finally, we will introduce the two-phase suspension system, followed by an exploration of practical industrial and geophysical applications of these complex flows.
schedule:
Week   Topic
1. Overview of granular material flows
2-3. Classification of fluid behavior: Newtonian and non-Newtonian fluid
4-6. Introduction to granular material flows (I): Flow characteristics
7-9. Introduction to granular material flows (II): Rheology and phenomenological model
10-11. Introduction to granular material flows (III): Micro-mechanisms and force chains
12-13. Discrete simulation: Discrete element method 
14-16. Two-phase suspension flow
17. Final Examination
18 Final group presentations
